content.question: During practice for a gymnastics competition, Tessa sprains her ankle, resulting in pain and some swelling in her ankle. Which of the following statements best explains how substance P contributes to her experience?

choices.label: Substance P is responsible for Tessa’s ankle sprain, directly causing a ligament in her ankle to tear.
Substance P enhances pain perception, contributing to Tessa’s pain when she sprains her ankle.
Substance P triggers Tessa’s fight-or-flight response, which will help her avoid further injury.
Substance P hinders Tessa from forming new memories, which will help her forget this incident and participate in future competitions.

content.answer: Substance P enhances pain perception, contributing to Tessa’s pain when she sprains her ankle.

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
